laligagate.title: #laligagate
laligagate.intro: is not just a hashtag. It's an alarm ‚Äî a call to rethink what kind of internet we want: one ruled by the interests of a few, or one where digital rights and fair access to content are fundamental pillars.

warning.title: ‚ö†Ô∏è This site is affected by LaLiga's blocks
warning.description: This website is among the thousands of URLs blocked by LaLiga in its effort to stop piracy. An indiscriminate blocking that affects legitimate sites like this one, showing the serious consequences of these disproportionate measures.

problem.title: The problem of mass blockings
problem.description: The court-ordered blockings requested by LaLiga have resulted in:

points.censorshipDesc: Thousands of domains affected without individual review
points.rightsDesc: Freedom of expression and access to information compromised
points.falsePositivesDesc: News sites, personal blogs and educational projects censored

imageCaption.hayahora: - Tool to track LaLiga's mass blockings and let any user check whether a website has been unfairly blocked.
imageCaption.judicial: DIGI message when trying to access content after an IP is blocked during football matches.

impact.title: The real impact on my projects
impact.description: This website is a clear example of the collateral damage caused by these measures. As a developer and content creator, my personal site has been blocked despite having no relation to sports piracy.

impact.massiveBlocks: Massive blockings do not only affect alleged piracy ‚Äî they create a domino effect that harms:
